Vincent Bagilet

              Vincent Bagilet
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         Email
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                         GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Hi and welcome to my personal website!
            I am a fourth year PhD student in Sustainable Development at Columbia University.
            My main research interests revolve around the determinants of environmental attitudes of individuals. I use observational data to study to what extent social norms, public policies and peer effects can affect the environmental consumption behavior of individuals.
            Overall, I am particularly enthusiastic about the use of unconventional data to analyze environment related issues. I also love working on projects that can help me develop my knowledge in causal inference and data visualization.
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Vincent Bagilet

articles.title: Projects
articles.description: A list of short and simple descriptions of some of my projects.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
I am currently working on a couple of papers linked to causal inference methods and a few projects on the determinants of environmental attitudes of individuals. Most of the later projects are still at an embryonic stage. I will share my progresses here as soon as these projects are more developed and polished.
Work in progress


Why Acute Health Effects of Air Pollution Could be Inflated
Paper with Léo Zabrocki.
The last version of the working paper can be downloaded here.
The project website can be accessed here.















Unconfounded but Inflated Causal Estimates
Paper with Léo Zabrocki.
The last version of the working paper can be downloaded here.
The project website can be accessed here.
